name: Trigeminocerebellar Compression Syndrome
chief_complaint: Severe facial pain with episodes of vertigo and difficulty walking

lab_results.MRI with contrast: Vascular loop compressing trigeminal nerve root entry zone and adjacent cerebellum

prognosis: Good with surgical intervention, though some residual ataxia may persist in chronic cases
description: A rare neurovascular compression syndrome where an aberrant arterial loop compresses both the trigeminal nerve root entry zone and adjacent cerebellar flocculus, causing combined trigeminal neuralgia and cerebellar dysfunction symptoms. The condition typically presents with characteristic episodic facial pain accompanied by vertigo and ataxia.
